newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: British Gas unit signs gas supply pact. [Corrected 11:15 GMT]
newsitem.headline: British Gas unit signs gas supply pact. [Corrected 11:15 GMT]

text.p: First Gas Holdings Corp signed on Thursday a memorandum of understanding (MoU) for the supply of gas with Shell Philippines Exploration B.V and Occidental Philippines Inc.

First Gas, a unit of BG Plc (formerly British Gas) (corrects name of company to BG Plc from British Gas) and First Philippine Holdings Corp, is putting up a 1,000-megawatt power plant in Santa Rita, Batangas, south of the capital.
Shell and Occidental are developers of the country's first commercial gas find at the Camago-Malampaya field, Palawan in southwwestern Philippines.
Shell Philippines Exploration is the local exploration arm of Royal Dutch/Shell group while Occidental Philippines is a unit of Occidental Petroleum of the U.S.

"This MoU will pave the way for a gas sales and purchase agreement that will lay the foundation for the creation of a natural gas industry in the Philippines," said First Gas president Peter Garrucho in a statement.
First Gas said the power plant will first run on condensate when it starts operation in January 1999.
Once commercial production from the Camago field begins by January 2002, the power plant will run on gas initially requiring 233 million cubic feet per day.
The power plant will be the first in the Philippines to run on gas.
President Fidel Ramos witnessed the signing of the agreement in London.
